Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • GameBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GameBoard
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Creates the main game panel in which the user plays the game by moving the Element pieces. All game actions take place in this class.
    Version:
    3.4, May 22th, 2014
    Author:
    Richard Dang and Benson Guo
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard()
        Constructor for GameBoard which sets up the background, guis,and level. ElementList object is instantiated and the key listener is added. score, numCorrect, and numWrong are intialized to 0. Paused is set to false. The menu items are also set to enabled.

        This method reads the image used for the background of the panel.

        Throws:

      • rightOrWrong

        public void rightOrWrong()
        This method reads the images used for correct and wrong naming of compounds.The labels are hidden on the panel until the user answers a question.
        Parameters:
        correct-BufferedImage - for correct picture.
        incorrect-BufferedImage - for incorrect picture.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when reading image file.

      • gameOptions

        public void gameOptions()
        This method sets up the gui buttons for the GameBoard. They are stored in the arrayList menuItems.
        Parameters:
        spacing-int - variabel for button spacing.
        counter-counter - variable for button spacing.
        news-BufferedImage - for new game button.
        resume-BufferedImage - for resume button.
        pause-BufferedImage - for pause button.
        end-BufferedImage - for end button.
        x-JButton - variable for for loop.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when reading image file.

      • displayInfo

        public void displayInfo()
        This method sets up the labels on the gameboard, which display information to user about the level, time left, and score. The JTextField is also set up. The labels are stored in an array.
        Parameters:
        spacing-int - variabel for label spacing
        labels-array - of JLabels to store labels.
        ok-BufferedImage - for ok button.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when reading image file.

        public void updateScore()
        This method updates the score label with the new score value.

      • saveScore

        public void saveScore()
        This method inserts the user score into the highscores.

      • drop

        public boolean drop()
        This method drops the controlLabel by one row if possible. It is a boolean return method and returns true if the element has been dropped, else if returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the there is an open location below the dropping piece, otherwise false

      • addBarriers

        public void addBarriers(int x1,
               int y1,
               int x2,
               int y2)
        This method adds two elements barriers by the passed in co-ordinates.
        Parameters:
        barrier1-JLabel - for 1st barrier.
        barrier2-JLabel - for 2nd barrier.
        x1-int - variable for 1st barrier's column passed in.
        y1-int - variable for 1st barrier's row passed in.
        x2-int - variable for 2nd barrier's column passed in.
        y2-int - variable for 2nd barrier's row passed in.

      • removeElements

        public void removeElements(int x1,
                  int y1,
                  int x2,
                  int y2)
        This method removes the two elements specified by the passed in co-ordinates. Elements above the removed elements are shifted down accordingly.
        Parameters:
        end-int - variable for row to start shifting elements down from.
        temp-temporary - int variable to store col/row value.
        y-int - counter variable for loop representing row.
        x1-int - variable for 1st element's column passed in.
        y1-int - variable for 1st element's row passed in.
        x2-int - variable for 2nd element's column passed in.
        y2-int - variable for 2nd element's row passed in.

      • repaintBoard

        public void repaintBoard()
        This method repaints the whole board based on the 2d JLabel array. A nested for loop goes through and sets the position of the label if it is not null.
        Parameters:
        y-int - counter variable for loop representing row.
        x-int - counter variable for loop representing column.

      • addNotify

        public void addNotify()
        This method focuses the Key Listener on the panel.
        Overrides:
        addNotify in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • pauseResume

        public void pauseResume()
        This method pauses or resumes the game based on the current state through an if statement.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Overridden method that moves the controlLabel based on the arrow keys that are pressed. If the down key is pressed the element drops to the end of the column. The 2d Element and JLabel array are changed according to the keyboard input. The board is repainted.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e-KeyEvent - variable passed in.
        x-int - counter variable for for loop.

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Overridden method for releasing keys.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e-KeyEvent - variable passed in.

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Overridden method for typing keys.
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e-KeyEvent - variable passed in.

      • askCompound

        public void askCompound()
        This method asks the user to name the compound formed. A keylistener is added to the textfield to moniter the enter key.

      • checkCompound

        public void checkCompound()
        This method looks for nearby elements that can form compounds with the element the user is controlling. If possible, the askCompound method will be called to ask the user to name the compound.
        Parameters:
        adjacent-variable - for adjacent element being checked.

      • checkInput

        public void checkInput()
        This method checks for the input of the user to see if they have named the compound correctly. Feedback will be given back to the user on the JTextField. A time deduction is given if the user has named the compound incorrectly. The scores are updated.
        Parameters:
        compoundName-String - variable for correct name of compound.

      • disableButtons

        public void disableButtons()
        Disables all the buttons on the gameboard.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Implemented abstract method that processes ActionEvents. If the continue button has been clicked, the game progresses the next level. If the minutes and seconds has reached 0, the game will end and progress to the next level. If the new game button has been clicked, the user will be asked to start a new game. If the pause/resume buttons are clicked, the game will pause/resume. If actionPerformed is triggered by the Timer, the current controlled element will drop or a new element will be created if the current element cannot drop any further. If the screen is filled with elements, the game will end.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae-ActionEvent - variable passed in.

      • nextLevel

        public void nextLevel()
        This method advances the game to the next level if not already on the highest difficulty. Else, it displays a congradulatory message. During this time, the menu items are enabled.

      • dialogBoxes

        public void dialogBoxes(java.lang.String title,
               java.lang.String text)
        This method creates a dialog box based on the String variables passed in as parameters.
        Parameters:
        dLabel-JLabel - for text on dialog box.
        continues-BufferedImage - for continue button.
        title-String - variable for dialog box title.
        text-String - variable for dialog box info.
        e-variable - to catch for IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown to indication a error when reading image file.

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        This method ends the correct game by stopping the timer and saving the score. During this time, all buttons are disabled.

      • newElement

        public void newElement()
        This element creates a new element for the user to control. The element will start dropping from the 12th column and 5th row. The new element is added onto the label and element 2d arrays.
        Parameters:
        newElement-element - variable for the new element.
        elementPic-BufferedImage - variable for element's picture.

      • paintComponent

        protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overridden method that draws a background image onto the the JPanel.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics: Allows components to be drawn onto the panel.
